intro: Eupatorium ivifolium, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that appear in late summer and early fall. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and woodland edges. Eupatorium ivifolium is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
